review: Using this device connected to the hdmi port on your tv will allow you to stream services like Netflix, Hulu+, amd YouTube. The best part is that you control it via your Android phone or tablet. I found it easy to use and set up. Well worth the money.
author: Apaini

review: Like what it does with Netflix and U tube.  Would be a lot better if you could view everything that you put on Google Plus into a single APP.  Can't view pictures from Google files.

review: It is surprisingly nice to be able to watch my youtube channels on the big screen. It sort of turns your tablet or phone into a universal control. The app selections are limited though. Originally I was under the impression that you could watch anything on your tablet or phone on the big screen, but sadly, it only works with certain apps. But if you hang out on Youtube and TED a lot then you will get plenty of enjoyment.

review: I bought this for a friend who thought Netflix was only available for her computer. We hooked it up to her 60 Inch HDTV, linked it up and off she went watching Netflix and YouTube.  Set up was extremely easy and now they are using the ChromeCast more than cable.

review: I bought it thinking I could stream my files from a windows home server 2011. Until Google releases a SDK this is useless for me.
